work.copy1: An orbiting body particle system.
work.copy2: A simplified model of our solar system.|This is created through a system of linked particles, with an orbital heirachy, which is to say a particle will rotate around its parent, whilst the parent rotates around its own parent.| There is no limit to the depth.|Sizes are sort-of correct for the planets, as are orbital radii. Moons have been fudged to make them visible, and the sun is way to small. If all sizes were accurate the planets would be too small to see!

work.copy1: An advanced particle effect to simulate fireflies swarming.
work.copy2: The particles have individual movement, which is influenced by points which attract or repel.|The drawing of the swarm as a whole is influenced by a population manager, which keeps count of the number of particles in each of a defined grid of cells. The more particles in a sector, the bigger the particle.|CSS blur and contrast filters are used on the canvas to soften the effect, and the fireflies appear to glow more brightly as they cluster together.|The effect takes a moment or two to build, just like real fireflies gathering.

Request animation frame (RAF), is currently the best way to control animation. It respects the browser's resources and everything stops when a tab is in the background. Great news for mobile batteries! But, you can't set the frames per second (fps), which defaults to about 60fps. However, a check for elapsed time within the RAF loop allows finer control. This is a simple demonstration of this technique.
